title: Retable of Saints Athanasius, Blaise, and Agatha

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of tempera on panel.

artist_display:
Master of Riglos
Spanish (Aragon), active c. 1435–60
dimensions:
Christ on the Cross: 69.8 × 81.2 cm (27 1/2 × 32 in.)
Painted surface: 61 × 73 cm (24 1/2 × 28 3/4 in.)
Coronation of the Virgin: 87.4 × 80.3 cm (34 3/8 × 31 5/8 in.)
Painted surface: 87.3 × 73 cm (34 × 28 3/4 in.)
Scenes from the Life of Saint Blaise: 154.3 × 69.8 cm (60 3/4 × 27 1/2 in.)
Painted surface: 125.7 × 66 cm (49 1/2 × 26 in.)
Saint Athanasius: 128.6 × 82 cm (50 5/8 × 32 1/4 in.)
Painted surface: 124.7 × 73.7 cm (49 1/8 × 29 in.)
Scenes from the Life of Saint Agatha: 154.5 × 69.8 cm (60 3/4 × 27 1/2 in.)
Painted surface: 127 × 66 cm (50 × 26 in.)
inscriptions:
Inscribed: Do / min / e in foro / re tu / o ar / gua / s me (on Saint Athanasius’s book), Quicum / que v[u]l[t] / sal[v]us / es[s]e a[n] / te om / nia o[pus] (on the angel’s book at right), Sal.... (on the angel’s scroll
at left)
publication_history:
Year Book of the Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, Chicago, 1924, p. 35. 

Chandler Rathfon Post, A History of Spanish Painting,, vol. 8, Cambridge, Mass.,  1941, pp. 378–80, fig. 169.

Juan Antonio Gaya Nuño, La pintura española fuera de España, Madrid, 1958, p. 308, no. 2703. 

The Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection, 1961, p. 420. 

José Camón Aznar, Pintura medieval española, Summa artis 22, Madrid, 1966,
p. 474. 

José Gudiol, Pintura medieval en Aragón, Saragossa, 1971, p. 83, no. 273. 

Judith Berg Sobré, Behind the Altar Table: The Development of the Painted Retable in Spain, 1350–1500, Columbia, Mo., 1989, p. 52 n. 12.

Judith Berg Sobré in Martha Wolff et al., Northern European and Spanish Paintings before 1600 in the Art Institute of Chicago, Chicago, 2008, pp. 92-95, ill.
provenance_text: Gift of the Antiquarian Society, 1911 [Registrar's records, Daybook, vol. 5, p. 8].

input: Retable of Saints Athanasius, Blaise, and Agatha
